title: What is Bitcoin?
lead: Learn more about Bitcoin and how it works.
description: Bitcoin is a decentralized, open-source, peer-to-peer digital currency. There's no government, institution (e.g. bank), or other authority that controls it. Transactions of the digital asset, bitcoin, are made with no middle men and are recorded in a public ledger called the blockchain. Sounds confusing? Learn more on how it works.

links.title: Bitcoin Explained - Illustrated Beginner's Guide
links.description: Quick and simple explanations: Discover how Bitcoin works and why it’s so popular.

links.title: Explain Bitcoin Like I’m Five
links.description: If you still can’t figure out what the heck a Bitcoin is...

links.title: How Bitcoin Actually Works
links.description: In this video, we take you “under the hood” to understand the basics of what makes bitcoin work. Learn what it means to own bitcoin, to send bitcoin and what mining is all about.

links.title: What Is Bitcoin?
links.description: Bitcoin is a digital currency that facilitates peer-to-peer transactions. The Bitcoin network is maintained by miners who add blocks to the blockchain. Bitcoin's supply is predetermined and cannot be changed.

links.title: Introduction to Bitcoin
links.description: Learn what bitcoin is, why it's different from current systems you already know (like banking), and how it might affect all of us in the future.

links.title: How Bitcoin Works Under the Hood
links.description: A somewhat technical explanation of how Bitcoin works.

title: Why Bitcoin?
lead: The case for Bitcoin.

links.title: What is Bitcoin and why does it matter?
links.description: Bitcoin is a revolutionary innovation on par with the printing press and internet.

links.title: The Bullish Case for Bitcoin
links.description: The bullish case for Bitcoin is compelling but far from obvious.

links.title: Bitcoin, Not Blockchain
links.description: Bitcoin and its blockchain are dependent on each other. One does not exist without the other. Bitcoin is the most secure blockchain and blockchains only work for money.

links.title: Can Governments Stop Bitcoin?
links.description: Bitcoin's worldwide success doesn't mean that people haven't tried to stop Bitcoin.

links.title: Dear Family, Dear Friends
links.description: A letter to all of you who still have no bitcoin.

links.title: Bitcoin Obsoletes All Other Money
links.description: When it comes to bitcoin adoption, there are generally two rules that never seem to fail. Everyone always feels late, and everyone always wishes they had bought more bitcoin.

links.title: Bitcoin is Time
links.description: Bitcoin is time in more ways than one. Its units are stored time because they are money, and its network is time because it is a decentralized clock.

links.title: The Number Zero and Bitcoin
links.description: Satoshi gave the world Bitcoin, a true “something for nothing.” His discovery of absolute scarcity for money is an unstoppable idea that is changing the world tremendously.

links.title: Bitcoin First
links.description: Why Investors Need to Consider Bitcoin Separately From Other Digital Assets.

title: Misconceptions
lead: Clarifying Bitcoin misconceptions.

links.title: Bitcoin is Protecting Human Rights Around the World
links.description: “It's an escape hatch from tyranny,” writes the Human Rights Foundation's Alex Gladstein. “It's nothing less than freedom money.”

links.title: The Spiral Book of Bitcoin Mythology
links.description: Since there are no more prominent or prevalent myths about bitcoin than those having to do with its environmental impact, we start there.

links.title: Bitcoin is Not for Criminals
links.description: Just as the internet is not for drug dealers and terrorists, bitcoin is not for criminals. It is for everyone.

links.title: Bitcoin’s Energy Usage Isn’t a Problem. Here’s Why.
links.description: Bitcoin’s energy usage is a rounding error as far as global energy usage is concerned.

links.title: Demystifying Bitcoin
links.description: This track aims to correct mainstream narratives about Bitcoin, debunk the most common Bitcoin myths, and offer insights and real-world experiences on its various benefits.

links.title: This Machine Greens
links.description: A film exploring Bitcoin and the future of clean energy production. Find out why Bitcoin is not the first currency to be so closely linked to energy... and why its intriguing design might be a net benefit for the future of decarbonization.

links.title: Bitcoin Policy Institute
links.description: Interdisciplinary cohort of economists, coders, lawyers, climate scientists, philosophers, and policy analysts providing research, fact-checking, and commentary on bitcoin.

links.title: End the FUD
links.description: The best links to articles debunking Bitcoin FUD.

title: What is Lightning?
lead: Learn how the Lightning Network works.
description: The Lightning Network is a second layer payment protocol that handles bitcoin transactions without the need to verify them on the blockchain. Learn more on how it works.

links.title: Bitcoin's Lightning Network, Simply Explained!
links.description: Bitcoin has a 7 transaction/second limit, so how can we overcome this? The Lightning Network is one of the proposals and in this video I'll explain how it works.

links.title: Lightning Network
links.description: Lightning Network is a protocol for scaling and speeding up blockchains.

links.title: LN.Guide - A Beginners Guide
links.description: This site aims to help people understand a little more on the mechanics of Lightning and how it interacts with the underlying Bitcoin network.

title: Buy Bitcoin
lead: Where to easily buy bitcoin.
description: KYC (Know Your Customer) is the practice of verifying the identity of clients. If you place a high priority on privacy, you should avoid buying bitcoin that requires KYC, as it means that your identity is tied to your purchases and the wallet addresses where that bitcoin is kept. Your data can be used to track your transactions.

links.title: Relai
links.description:
Investing in bitcoin made easy. Instant start, no deposit, auto invest, no registration, high security.
Referral code: REL1080

links.title: Peach
links.description:
Peach is a mobile application that connects Bitcoin Buyers & Sellers together.
Referral code: PR9D17

links.title: Bisq - a decentralized bitcoin exchange
links.description: Open-source desktop application that allows you to buy and sell bitcoins in exchange for national currencies.

links.title: Hodl Hodl
links.description: A global multisig P2P bitcoin trading platform that doesn't hold funds.

links.title: Coin ATM Radar
links.description: Find Bitcoin ATM locations easily with the Bitcoin ATM Map.

links.title: Swan Bitcoin
links.description: Swan makes bitcoin investing easy. Buy automatically every week, month, or paycheck, starting with as little as $5.

links.title: Kraken
links.description: One of the most trusted cryptocurrency exchanges on the market.

links.title: River Financial
links.description: River is the premier bitcoin financial institution for the sophisticated investor.

links.title: SBB Ticket Machine
links.description: You can top up your bitcoin wallet quickly and easily at any time and at any SBB ticket machine.

title: Software Wallets
lead: Best software wallets to store your bitcoin.
description: Software wallets are non-physical programs (e.g. apps) that store your private keys. Software wallets are more accessible and convenient, but not as secure as hardware wallets. Here are some of best and most secure open-source non-custodial bitcoin wallets.

links.title: BlueWallet - Bitcoin wallet
links.description: A bitcoin wallet for iOS and android. Bitcoin should be fun, usable and for anyone.

links.title: Samourai
links.description: A modern bitcoin wallet hand forged to keep your transactions private your identity masked and your funds.

links.title: Blockstream Green
links.description: Blockstream Green is an industry-leading bitcoin wallet, providing Bitcoin users with an unrivaled blend of security and ease-of-use.

links.title: Muun
links.description: Muun is a self-custodial wallet for bitcoin and lightning.

links.title: Sparrow Wallet
links.description: Sparrow is a modern desktop Bitcoin wallet application supporting most hardware wallets and built on common standards such as PSBT, with an emphasis on transparency and usability.

links.title: Zap
links.description: Transactions with Zap are inexpensive and instantaneous, unlocking a new natively digital economy never seen before.

links.title: Phoenix
links.description: The bitcoin wallet from the future, native Lightning support, non custodial, intuitive and simple UX.

links.title: Breez
links.description: Lightning Fast Bitcoin Payments

links.title: Electrum Wallet
links.description: One of the most popular bitcoin wallets.

links.title: Bitcoin Core Wallet
links.description: Official bitcoin wallet for desktop.

title: Hardware Wallets
lead: Best hardware wallets to store your bitcoin.
description: A hardware wallet is a type of bitcoin wallet that stores your private keys on a specially designed secure physical hardware device. They’re considered safer than software wallets, as the keys are stored offline.

links.title: Trezor
links.description: The original and most secure hardware wallet.

links.title: Coldcard
links.description: Coldcard is the ultrasecure bitcoin hardware wallet.

links.title: Bitbox
links.description: Protect your digital assets with the latest Swiss made hardware wallet.

links.title: Passport
links.description: Next-gen hardware wallet that makes it easier than ever to securely store your Bitcoin.

links.title: SeedSigner
links.description: Use an air-gapped Raspberry Pi Zero to sign for Bitcoin transactions, generate seed word 12/24, or generate a seed phrase from dice rolls.

links.title: Specter DIY Hardware Wallet
links.description: Specter DIY is an open-source hardware wallet with large touchscreen, a QR-code scanner and a smartcard-reader.

title: Multisig Solutions
lead: Multi-Signature for enhanced security.
description: Multisig, short for multi-signature, is a security protocol that requires at least two keys to authorize a transaction. It can be seen as a lock that only opens with enough keys out of a predefined set of keys. Enhance the security of your bitcoin wallet with multisig.

links.title: Specter Desktop - Multisig Made Easy
links.description: Specter Desktop functions as a watch-only coordinator for multi-signature and single-key bitcoin wallets.

links.title: Sparrow Wallet
links.description: Sparrow is a modern desktop Bitcoin wallet application supporting most hardware wallets and built on common standards such as PSBT, with an emphasis on transparency and usability.

links.title: Bitcoin Keeper
links.description: A secure bitcoin multi-sig wallet with privacy and inheritance.

links.title: Nunchuk
links.description: A simple multisig self-custody solution for your bitcoin.

links.title: BlueWallet - Multisig
links.description: The most secure Bitcoin technology. Multisig wallets are like a vault, where multiple keys are needed to spend.

links.title: Caravan
links.description: Caravan is a Bitcoin multisig wallet you can use right in the browser.

links.title: Unchained Capital Vault
links.description: Get enhanced security with an easy-to-use multisig vault solution that leaves you with sovereignty over your keys and bitcoin.

links.title: Casa Keymaster
links.description: Casa Keymaster multisig is the safest way to store your bitcoin. Own your keys for total peace of mind.

title: Storage
lead: Secure your seeds and hardware wallets.
description: Harden your security model and ensure the safety of your seeds and hardware wallets.

links.title: SmallSeed
links.description: Super compact crypto cold storage on stainless steel.

links.title: SEEDPLATE
links.description: A better bitcoin seed metal backup plate!

links.title: Metal Bitcoin Seed Storage Reviews
links.description: Stress tests and reviews of seed storage devices.

links.title: Blockmit Washer Jig
links.description: The Blockmit jig is perfect for keeping your spacing perfect when punching your own seed phrase into washers.

links.title: Privacy Pros Faraday Bags
links.description: Protects electronics from being damaged by radio frequency interference (RFI) or from an electromagnetic pulse (EMP) by not allowing radio frequency or electromagnetic pulse waves to pass through the material.

links.title: Silent Pocket Faraday Bags
links.description: Wallets, bags, sleeves + more that make your devices invisible to the world.

title: Bitcoin Nodes
lead: Run your personal Bitcoin node.
description: The Bitcoin network is a decentralized peer-to-peer (P2P) network made up of thousands of nodes. Each node keeps a copy of the Bitcoin blockchain and verifies every single transaction and block. By running a full node you can verify the state of the ledger yourself, rather than trusting a third party. Running a full node also makes the network more robust, making it more decentralized and resistant to certain types of attacks.

links.title: Umbrel
links.description: Run your own Bitcoin and Lightning Network node on a Raspberry Pi. Use Bitcoin to its full potential.

links.title: Citadel
links.description: Citadel allows you to run a Bitcoin Lightning node or a personal server on a Raspberry Pi. Citadel is proudly Free and open-source software (FOSS). Anyone is free to use, copy, study, and change the software in any way.

links.title: myNode
links.description: myNode aims to be the easiest way to run a dedicated, easy to use, Bitcoin Node and Lightning wallet.

links.title: RaspiBlitz
links.description: The RaspiBlitz is a do-it-yourself Lightning Node based on LND running together with a Bitcoin-Fullnode.

links.title: Start9 Labs - Embassy
links.description: A radical, uncompromising, plug and play personal server, offering one-click installation and simple configuration of open source software services that run over Tor.

links.title: Mempool.space
links.description: An open-source explorer developed for the Bitcoin community, focusing on the transition into a multi-layer ecosystem.

links.title: Bitcoin Explorer
links.description: Free, open-source, easy-to-setup, easy-to-use, self-hosted explorer

title: Money and Economics

links.title: What is Money, Anyway?
links.description: People spend their lives seeking money, and in some ways it seems so straightforward, and yet what humanity has defined as money has changed significantly over the centuries.

links.title: Shelling Out: The Origins of Money
links.description: Primitive money was not modern money as we know it.

links.title: How The Economic Machine Works by Ray Dalio
links.description: Breaks down economic concepts like credit, deficits and interest rates, basic driving forces behind the economy, how economic policies work and why economic cycles occur.

links.title: Principles for Dealing with the Changing World Order by Ray Dalio
links.description: I believe the world is changing in big ways that haven't happened before in our lifetimes but have many times in history, so I knew I needed to study past changes to understand what is happening now and help me to anticipate what is likely to happen.
